title: Junk Has Never Been So Valued
summary: The average yield on low-rated bonds falls below 4% for the first time.. If you're an over-leveraged company at risk of default, now's your moment to load up on more debt. The average yield on U.S. junk bonds dropped below 4% for the first time on Monday amid a market scavenger hunt for higher returns.

title: The Costs of Killing Keystone XL
summary: Even allies are asking Biden to reconsider his executive order.. President Biden may not have buyers' remorse over his executive order canceling the Keystone XL oil pipeline, but many others are raising the political price for his job-killing decision. And some of the second thoughts are coming from his own coalition.

title: Biden Sacks a Corruption Prober
summary: Even Senate Democrats wonder why he ousted an Illinois U.S. Attorney.. A new President abruptly fires a prosecutor overseeing high-level political corruption cases. That's big news, right? Well, it was in 2017 when President Trump axed Preet Bharara, the U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York at the time and a media favorite. You can tell power in Washington has changed hands because of the muted response as the Biden White House ousts U.S. Attorney John Lausch of the Northern District of Illinois.

title: Schumer Says Senate Democrats Working to Raise Minimum Wage
summary: Including the measure in Covid-19 relief legislation faces procedural hurdles and opposition from at least one Senate Democrat. title: Lyft Curbs Losses With Aggressive Cost Cuts
summary: Ride-hailing company's president says $360 million in cost savings last year bodes well for the future. title: U.S. Chamber of Commerce Board Names Clark New CEO
summary: Successor to longtime leader Thomas Donohue will be first woman to lead organization. WASHINGTON-The U.S. Chamber of Commerce on Tuesday named Suzanne Clark as its new chief executive, succeeding retiring CEO Thomas Donohue, who has led the organization since 1997.

title: 'A Shot in the Moonlight' Review: Vigilantes in the Dock
summary: It was the ﬁrst time that a black man in the South had dared to sue a white mob for damages, and it caused a sensation.. Around 12 o'clock on the cold, moonlit night of Jan. 21, 1897, a 42-year-old black farmer named George Dinning, his wife, Mollie, and seven of their children were sleeping in their cabin near Price's Mill, Ky., when they were awakened by two dozen white men surrounding the house. Wielding pistols and shotguns, the mob accused Dinning of some recent thefts and ordered him to vacate his 125-acre farm, which he had purchased 20 years before from the family that had enslaved him.

title: Activist Investor Ancora to Launch Proxy Fight at Forward Air
summary: Group plans to nominate four directors to trucking company's board. An activist investor is preparing to launch a proxy fight at trucking and logistics company Forward Air Corp.

title: U.S. Covid-19 Campaign Will Press for Social Distancing, Mask Wearing
summary: Strategy will delay broader vaccine awareness push until supply increases and instead target vaccine skepticism in narrower effort. The Biden administration plans to ramp up a public safety campaign focused on social distancing and mask wearing to curb the spread of Covid-19 in the coming weeks as states begin relaxing public-health measures, according to a person familiar with the matter.

summary: Corn growers say they would like new administration to maintain federal backing for ethanol as fuel additive. U.S. farmers want President Biden to see them as partners in fighting climate change.

title: Most Salesforce Employees to Work Remotely at Least Part Time
summary: Software giant plans for staff to work from office several days a week or from home full-time, with just a fraction required on site daily. summary: Stocks mixed after S&P 500's record close. U.S. stocks finished mixed on Tuesday, with investors taking a breather after a brief record run.

summary: The apartment had been on the market for less than a month and sold after just one showing. Caroline Wozniacki, the retired professional tennis player, and her husband, former New York Knicks player David Lee, have sold their Miami-area condominium for $16.25 million, less than a month after listing it for $17.5 million, according to the listing agents on the deal.

summary: New York state is expected to get a 5% increase in vaccine doses over next few weeks. title: 'The Map of Tiny Perfect Things' Review: Rom-Com Merry-Go-Round
summary: Kyle Allen and Kathryn Newton play teenagers stuck in a 'Groundhog Day'-like time loop.. 'Groundhog Day" was released in theaters 28 years ago (Feb. 12, 1993) and has only grown in stature over the years; it ranks alongside "Rashomon" as a 20th-century-born archetype of cinematic storytelling. Imitations, naturally, abound: Last year's "Palm Springs" was yet another variation on the theme. But when a movie comes right out and acknowledges its debt-as does "The Map of Tiny Perfect Things"-it does a lot to win you over.

title: 'If I Can't Have You: The Jodi Arias Story' Review: Outrage Revisited
summary: A Discovery+ documentary re-examines the sensational 2013 murder trial that turned the accused into a public villain.. Jodi Arias was young, beautiful and by every indication a ruthless murderer, a combination that made her not only an object of media fascination when she went on trial in 2013 but of public vilification that seemed to take on a life of its own. It was a sensational case-Arias, now serving life without parole, had presented a number of wildly different stories at the beginning of the investigation, wound up testifying to her own disadvantage for 18 days, and was at the center of an event that was widely considered a circus. It was a sordid affair, but the way it occupied the intersection of criminal justice and the media gave it a special place among capital cases,

title: Coronavirus Likely Came From Animal, Not Laboratory, WHO Says
summary: Preliminary assessment follows visit by team of experts to Wuhan, China, in search for origin of pandemic. WUHAN, China-The virus that causes Covid-19 most likely jumped from one species to another before entering the human population and is highly unlikely to have leaked from a laboratory, a leader of a World Health Organization investigative team said at a press conference here.

title: Heart Strings (Wednesday Crossword, February 10)
Fining Nonvoters Is a Terrifically Good Idea
summary: I look forward to working with Republicans and Democrats alike on making our democracy more accessible.. Regarding your editorial "Didn't Vote? Here's Your $20 Fine" (Feb. 5): In January, I suggested that voting should be considered a civic duty. The response has been a bit surprising. The editorial board questions whether there was an inherent benefit to high voter turnout. One of my colleagues told a talk radio host that I was looking to establish "voting police." With fervor, conservatives have risen to the defense of every citizen's right to disengage from civic life.

title: Equity, Equality, Fairness and Good Sense
summary: As Mr. Riley states, equality can be interpreted as equal opportunity, while equity can assume an equal outcome. Jason Riley's "Progressives Put the Racial 'Equity' Squeeze on Biden" (Upward Mobility, Feb. 3) touches on the importance of controlling the narrative. The "E-word" used to stand for equality. But over the last few years diversity, equality and inclusion initiatives now speak to equity. Why the difference? As Mr. Riley states, equality can be interpreted as equal opportunity, while equity can assume an equal outcome, that a society's wealth is owned in common and not primarily by those who create it. Equity means everyone has an equal share of the pie regardless of the contribution.

title: Biden Is Right on Start Treaty With Russia
summary: Keep your friends close, but your enemies closer.. Your editorial "Joe Biden's Old Russia Start" (Feb. 2) notes that President Biden criticized Vladimir Putin for arresting Russian dissident Alexei Navalny but then offered Russia a "gift" by extending the expiring New Start nuclear arms treaty. Dissidents should never be linked to diplomacy over something as existential as nuclear war. If U.S. Presidents Nixon and Reagan had refused to negotiate nuclear-arms reductions with Russian leaders because of the way Moscow mistreated its dissidents, America's most enduring nuclear treaties with Russia would never have helped both sides avoid nuclear war.

title: Europe Trades Long-Term For Short-Term Interests
summary: The primacy of their commercial interests is cited by Walter Russell Mead as the reason Germany and Europe decline to support the U.S. to counter Russia and China.. The primacy of their commercial interests is cited by Walter Russell Mead as the reason Germany and Europe decline to support the U.S. to counter Russia and China ("Eurocrats Are From Pluto," Global View, Feb. 2). Lenin may not have said the exact words "the capitalists will sell us the rope to hang them with," though he expressed similar sentiments. Nothing has changed in Europe in 100 years.

title: Kobe Bryant Helicopter Crashed Because Pilot Flew Into Clouds
summary: NTSB recommends stepped-up training in final report of last year's fatal accident that killed the basketball icon and eight others. title: Suspicious Activity Reports Related to Cash Transactions Surge
summary: Filings related to transactions just below the threshold for currency transaction reports hit a record in 2020, data shows. title: Do You Need a High-Tech Face Mask?
summary: We tested a few 'smart,' app-enabled masks to see if they're too much trouble-or a breath of tech air. title: How to Negotiate and Counter a Job Offer
summary: Most Popular News. Being offered a job is a reason to celebrate, but it is also an opportunity to negotiate the best terms you can get, which may not come up again for a while. title: Historians Ordered to Apologize for Naming Polish Mayor in Holocaust Dispute
summary: Historians' study had identified a local official as an accused collaborator with the Nazis. title: U.A.E.'s Hope Mars Mission Puts SUV-Size Craft in Orbit Around Red Planet
summary: The spacecraft is the first interplanetary probe from an Arab nation. title: Hong Kong's Top Court Denies Bail to Jimmy Lai
summary: Panel of five judges rules lower court was wrong to free the media mogul, raising the bar for bail in national-security cases. HONG KONG-Hong Kong's highest court has denied bail to pro-democracy newspaper publisher Jimmy Lai, the most prominent figure facing prosecution under a sweeping national-security law imposed by Beijing to silence opposition after a year of unrest.

title: Mary Wilson, Co-Founder of the Supremes, Dies at 76
summary: Singer who found fame with Diana Ross and Florence Ballard, died late Monday at her home in Las Vegas. LAS VEGAS-Mary Wilson, the longest-reigning original member of the Supremes, has died at 76.

title: Japan Keeps Its Covid Fight Simple With a Rule Starting at Dinnertime
summary: Resume Subscription. TOKYO-Call it the Zen art of lockdowns. In the fight to suppress Covid-19, Japan has found success by stripping down its policy to one simple measure: closing restaurants and bars at 8 p.m.

title: Providing Timely ESG Information Is Becoming More Crucial for CFOs
summary: Analysts and investors rely on data when evaluating a company's outlook, creditworthiness. Providing frequent updates about the sustainability of their business is becoming more crucial for finance chiefs, as analysts and investors increasingly rely on this information when evaluating a company's outlook and its creditworthiness.

title: Covid-19 Mortgage Relief Ends Soon for Millions of Homeowners
summary: Many who struggle during the pandemic won't be able to resume paying their monthly mortgage bills when yearlong forbearance plans run out. When Jen and Brian Bononi signed up to postpone their mortgage payments last April, they thought it would be for six months at most.

title: Stores Have a Mission: Getting You to Keep That Thing You Bought Online
summary: With more shopping moving online for good, retailers introduce new tools to rein in costly returns; 3-D body scans. The surge in pandemic-fueled online shopping has created a new urgency to solve a decades-old problem: returns.

title: Diamond Prices Regain Their Sparkle
summary: Pent-up jewelry demand has lifted the gems' valuations while online sales have grown. Diamond prices have rebounded from a coronavirus-driven slump thanks to the reopening of some economies in Asia and strong jewelry sales around the world over the holiday period.

title: Getting Teachers the Covid-19 Vaccine Is a Hurdle to Reopening Schools
summary: As educators face vaccination access issues and some voice hesitancy, the CDC is set to release new recommendations on reopenings. A key to reopening school doors is getting teachers vaccinated against the coronavirus. That isn't as straightforward as moving them to the front of the line for shots.

title: Biden Administration to Ask Dozens of Trump-Appointed Prosecutors to Resign
summary: Justice Department is expected to spare the prosecutor leading the Hunter Biden tax probe. Acting Attorney General Monty Wilkinson plans to ask holdover U.S. attorneys appointed by former President Donald Trump to resign, officials familiar with the matter said, as the Biden administration moves to put its stamp on the Justice Department.

title: Pepper...and Salt
summary: Resume Subscription. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: U.K. Property Market Poised for a Post-Brexit Comeback
summary: With Britain's EU exit completed and Covid-19 vaccinations rolling ahead, analysts foresee a strong rebound in 2021. Britain is trapped in its third national lockdown as it battles a more contagious strain of the coronavirus. Its economy is likely to shrink again in the first quarter. But analysts are still forecasting a strong real estate rebound this year.

title: U.S. Prosecutors Investigate Honduras President for Taking Drug-Related Bribes
summary: Filing marks first time American prosecutors have made public that they are investigating the president. MEXICO CITY-U.S. prosecutors are investigating the president of Honduras for accepting bribes to protect drug traffickers who shipped tons of cocaine to the U.S., according to a court filing.

title: U.S. Rep. Ron Wright Dies After Contracting Covid-19
summary: Texas Republican, aged 67, was just beginning second term. Rep. Ron Wright (R., Texas) died on Sunday after contracting Covid-19, according to his campaign office, becoming the first member of Congress to die from the coronavirus while in office.

title: Reddit CEO Backs WallStreetBets Amid Calls for Stiffer Moderation
summary: Chief of the social network whose users sparked GameStop stock-trading frenzy expresses confidence in its user-reliant model for policing speech. Reddit Inc.'s role in the recent stock-trading frenzy has brought millions of new users to the social-media platform, its chief executive says, as well as scrutiny to the power of large communities online.

title: Boeing Board Failed to Challenge CEO, Lawsuit Says
summary: Then-CEO Dennis Muilenburg focused on negative press following crashes, according to newly revealed communications. Boeing Co. 's board failed to challenge then-Chief Executive Dennis Muilenburg on the safety of the 737 MAX or his campaign to counter negative news reports between two fatal crashes that claimed 346 lives, according to newly released portions of a shareholders' lawsuit that cites internal company documents.

title: Trump Lawyers Call Impeachment Trial 'Political Theater'
summary: Proceedings are set to start Tuesday and could include witnesses. WASHINGTON-Lawyers for Donald Trump argued it is unconstitutional for the Senate to hold an impeachment trial for a former president and denounced the case as "political theater," while Democrats said Mr. Trump was trying to escape accountability for allegedly inciting last month's riot at the Capitol.

title: Reddit's Valuation Doubles to $6 Billion After Funding Round
summary: Its WallStreetBets community played a prominent role in recent stock-trading frenzy. Reddit Inc. doubled its valuation to $6 billion in a new round of funding that comes as the social-media company has added users through the Covid-19 pandemic and more recently has gained attention for its role in the recent Wall Street trading frenzy.

title: Hacker Changed Chemical Level in Florida City's Water System
summary: Public wasn't in danger, Pinellas County sheriff says; investigation has been launched. A water-treatment plant in Oldsmar, Fla., was hacked, and the intruder briefly increased the amount of lye used to treat water to a dangerous level, authorities said Monday.

title: Colombia to Grant Many Undocumented Venezuelans With Legal Status
summary: President Duque calls on other countries to act in solidarity with refugees. Bogotá, Colombia-President Iván Duque's conservative government said Monday that it will provide nearly a million undocumented Venezuelan migrants with temporary protected status, giving them the right to live and work in this country for 10 years.

title: Biden, India's Modi Discuss Myanmar, Security Challenges Posed by China
summary: U.S. president has yet to speak with China's leader, but phone calls with allies have set the stage. WASHINGTON-President Biden spoke with Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday, discussing regional security issues that revolve around China and the upheaval in Myanmar, the White House said.
